None.

In iOS 19, I want the equivalent of “iOS Snow Leopard.”

I want Apple to take a breather and fully concentrate on performance; bug fixes; streamlined, efficient code; an updated, more robust kernel—the solid foundation upon which all else runs.

Bertrand Serlet, WWDC 2009:

Revamped keyboard
fonts
new ui

#One click to place the cursor wherever you want it to be.
I challenge @Apple

An actually intelligent Apple Intelligence  When I read that the “demo” they presented in the pre-recorded videos were just mock ups, they lost trust with so many folks. This is why they need to go back to doing LIVE Keynotes. @craigfederighi @tim_cook @gregjoz

MAKE MY KEYBOARD SOUND NOT SUDDENLY JUMP TO 3000%

Thanks.

Support for real-time language translation with Airpods would be outstanding. I'd also love to see some actual Siri improvements, instead of the "do you want me to use ChatGPT to answer that?". Apple Intelligence has been a fairly useless feature so far.
A simplified and self explanatory menu rather than the impenetrable options that the vast majority never fully understand.

Less bugs and more continuity man. I can’t be swiping to go back for 2 menus and having to tap the back arrow in the top left of another 2 menus in the same app. It drives me insane!! 3rd party apps, yes but apple should force it down their throats if need be.
